block.p: A MEXICAN SUCCESS STORY The conquest of Mexico's tortilla king demonstrates the cronyism and unfair business practices that prevail in Mexico even as the Government touts a commitment to an open economy. A1
ZAIRE SEALS OFF REFUGEE CAMP Zairian soldiers sealed off trade from 190,000 refugees in the Kibumba camp, the latest effort by the United Nations to force the refugees to return to Rwanda. A3
CABINET TALKS COLLAPSE IN ITALY Hopes for a reform of Italy's political system collapsed after Prime Minister-designate Antonio Maccanico abandoned his two-week effort to form a Government. A4

BOSNIAN SERBS DETAIN MUSLIMS Bosnian Serbs said they had detained several Muslims who wandered into areas under their control, and a sniper believed to be a Bosnian Serb opened fire on a bus outside Sarajevo, wounding two people. A7
MIXED SIGNALS FROM SUDAN Sudan has shown some cooperation with Western demands that it not allow terrorists to operate in the country, even as it has threatened retaliation. A6
SAMPER CHARGED IN COLOMBIA Colombia's chief prosecutor formally charged President Ernesto Samper before the Congress with the crimes of illegal enrichment, electoral fraud and coverup. A12

THE POLICE UNION Angry that the police union pushed its arbitration bill through the state legislature, the Giuliani Administration warned that to offset the new law's costs it was considering several steps that many police officers will undoubtedly view as punitive -- including ordering the use of one-person patrol cars.
